remarks: Degree of multiplication of a polynomial on the left by a non-zero-dividing scalar.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 29-Mar-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 25-Jul-2019.)
statement:
deg1mul3.d $e |- D = ( deg1 ` R ) $.
deg1mul3.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
deg1mul3.e $e |- E = ( RLReg ` R ) $.
deg1mul3.b $e |- B = ( Base ` P ) $.
deg1mul3.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` P ) $.
deg1mul3.a $e |- A = ( algSc ` P ) $.
deg1mul3 $p |- ( ( R e. Ring /\ F e. E /\ G e. B ) -> ( D ` ( ( A ` F ) .x. G ) ) = ( D ` G ) ) $.
